abstract.para: This guide provides information on how to upgrade your Eclipse Vert.x 3.x applications to Eclipse Vert.x 4.0 Beta.

preface.title: Preface
preface.simpara: This guide describes the updates in Eclipse Vert.x 4.0 Beta release. Use the information to upgrade your Eclipse Vert.x 3.x applications to Eclipse Vert.x 4.0 Beta.

chapter.title: About Eclipse Vert.x
chapter.simpara: Eclipse Vert.x is a toolkit used for creating reactive, non-blocking, and asynchronous applications that run on the JVM (Java Virtual Machine). It contains several components that help you create reactive applications. It is designed to be cloud-native.
Since Eclipse Vert.x supports asynchronous applications it can be used to create applications with high volume of messages, large event processing, HTTP interactions, and so on.

chapter.title: Configuring your application
chapter.simpara: When you start configuring your applications to use Eclipse Vert.x, you must reference the Eclipse Vert.x BOM (Bill of Materials) artifact in the pom.xml file at the root directory of your application
